physical_appearance: This is a ten cents Japanese government currency. The note is printed in blue ink. The number '1/4' is printed on the four corners of the note. The words in the center are in capitals. The currency features some scroll decoratives along the border. There are some kanji inscriptions along the bottom of the note. The note is quite worn out, with some tears and folds around the edges.
sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steeleâ€™s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: 1/4 Rupee Japanese banana money
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war occupation currency Kanji (writing system)

context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
